required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-World Effectiveness of Regorafenib in the Treatment of Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Real-World Effectiveness of Regorafenib in the Treatment of Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma-A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Real-World Effectiveness of Regorafenib in the Treatment of Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma

detailed_description.textblock: To analyze the real-world usage pattern, effectiveness and factors associated with the effectiveness of regorafenib in the treatment of patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma. This retrospective, observational study included clinicopathological and follow-up data of patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma who were treated with regorafenib from June 2017 to September 2020. Patients with incomplete data were excluded. Overall survival (OS) stratified by combination therapy with programmed cell death ligand-1 (PD-L1) inhibitors, chemotherapy and regorafenib dose was calculated by Kaplan Meier method and log rank test. R software version 4.0 was used for the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: The difference in overall survival between the two groups calculated by Kaplan-Meier
primary_outcome.description: Survival differences between the monotherapy and combination groups

primary_outcome.measure: The difference of overall survival in patients receiving different doses of regorafenib
primary_outcome.description: In the real world, regorafenib was used in different dosages: 40mg,80mg,120mg,160mg,respectively. The difference in overall survival time of patients with different dosage was compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Regorafenib in combination with other drugs
primary_outcome.description: In the real world, regorafenib was used in combination with chemotherapy, immunotherapy or other drugs, and the frequency of occurrence of different conditions was analyzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival differences among the patients with different clinical phenotypes and genotypes
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the survival of patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma by gender, age, tumor site and other genotypes

arm_group.description: Patients were given only regorafenib orally
The patient was treated with regorafenib orally and in combination with other medications

study_pop.textblock: Patients with pathologically proven Hepatocellular Carcinoma whose disease progressed after two lines of antitumor therapy were treated with regorafenib alone or in combination.

criteria.textblock:
1. Inclusion Criteria:
1. Must be a pathologically proven Hepatocellular Carcinoma
2. Must have been treated with regorafenib
3. Regorafenib must be used after two lines of standard antitumor therapy
2. Exclusion Criteria:
1. Application is less than one course of treatment with regorafenib
2. First - or second-line treatment with regorafenib
3. Patients with multiple primary cancers
